intro: Pilosella congregata, commonly known as the clustered goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Pilosella congregata has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
